member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.Converters.CrsConverter
member.summary: Converts types to and from JSON.

member.name: M:GeoJSON.Net.Converters.CrsConverter.CanConvert(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance can convert the specified object type.
member.returns: true if this instance can convert the specified object type; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:GeoJSON.Net.Converters.CrsConverter.ReadJson(Newtonsoft.Json.JsonReader,System.Type,System.Object,Newtonsoft.Json.JsonSerializer)
member.summary: Reads the JSON representation of the object.
member.param: The existing value of object being read.
member.exception: CRS must be null or a json object or CRS must have a "type" property

member.summary: Writes the JSON representation of the object.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.DefaultCRS
member.summary: The default CRS is a geographic coordinate reference system, using the WGS84 datum, and with longitude and latitude units of decimal degrees. see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-4
member.remarks: Defines the GeoJSON Coordinate Reference System Objects (CRS) types originally defined in the geojson.org v1.0 spec see http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#coordinate-reference-system-objects. The current RFC removes the CRS type, but allows to be left in for backwards compatibility. See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-4

member.name: M:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.DefaultCRS.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.DefaultCRS.Instance
member.summary: Gets the instance.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.LinkedCRS
member.summary: Defines the Linked CRS type.
member.remarks: This was originally defined in the spec http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#named-crs The current RFC removes the CRS type, but allows to be left in for backwards compatibility. See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-4

member.name: M:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.LinkedCRS.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The mandatory href member must be a dereferenceable URI.
The optional type member will be put in the properties Dictionary

member.name: M:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.LinkedCRS.#ctor(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The mandatory href member must be a dereferenceable URI.
The optional type member will be put in the properties Dictionary

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.CRSType
member.summary: Defines the GeoJSON Coordinate Reference System Objects (CRS) types as originally defined in the geojson.org v1.0 spec
member.remarks: Originally defined http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#coordinate-reference-system-objects The current RFC removes the CRS type, but allows to be left in for backwards compatibility. See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-4

member.name: F:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.CRSType.Unspecified
member.summary: Defines a CRS type where the CRS cannot be assumed

member.summary: Defines the Named CRS type.

member.name: F:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.CRSType.Link
member.summary: Defines the Linked CRS type.

member.summary: Base Interface for CRSBase Object types.

member.summary: Gets the CRS type.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.NamedCRS
member.summary: Defines the Named CRS type.
member.remarks: See http://geojson.org/geojson-spec.html#named-crs The current RFC removes the CRS type, but allows to be left in for backwards compatibility. See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7946#section-4

member.name: M:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.NamedCRS.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The mandatory name member must be a string identifying a coordinate reference system. OGC CRS URNs such as 'urn:ogc:def:crs:OGC:1.3:CRS84' shall be preferred over legacy identifiers such as 'EPSG:4326'.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.CoordinateReferenceSystem.UnspecifiedCRS
member.summary: Represents an unspecified Coordinate Reference System i.e. where a geojson object has a null crs

member.summary: Gets the CRS type.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.DoubleTenDecimalPlaceComparer
member.summary: Compares doubles for equality.
member.remarks: 10 decimal places equates to accuracy to 11.1 Î¼m.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.GeoJSONObject
member.summary: Base class for all IGeometryObject implementing types

member.name: P:GeoJSON.Net.GeoJSONObject.BoundingBoxes
member.summary: Gets or sets the (optional) Bounding Boxes.
member.value: The value of must be a 2*n array where n is the number of dimensions represented in the contained geometries, with the lowest values for all axes followed by the highest values. The axes order of a bbox follows the axes order of geometries. In addition, the coordinate reference system for the bbox is assumed to match the coordinate reference system of the GeoJSON object of which it is a member.

member.name: P:GeoJSON.Net.GeoJSONObject.CRS
member.summary:
Gets or sets the (optional)
Coordinate Reference System Object.

member.summary: Gets the (mandatory) type of the GeoJSON Object. However, for GeoJSON Objects only the 'Point', 'MultiPoint', 'LineString', 'MultiLineString', 'Polygon', 'MultiPolygon', or 'GeometryCollection' types are allowed.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.Geometry.Polygon
member.summary: Defines the Polygon type. Coordinates of a Polygon are a list of linear rings coordinate arrays. The first element in the array represents the exterior ring. Any subsequent elements represent interior rings (or holes).

member.param: The linear rings with the first element in the array representing the exterior ring. Any subsequent elements represent interior rings (or holes).

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.Geometry.Position
member.summary: A position is the fundamental geometry construct. The "coordinates" member of a geometry object is composed of one position (in the case of a Point geometry) , an array of positions (LineString or MultiPoint geometries), an array of arrays of positions (Polygons, MultiLineStrings), or a multidimensional array of positions (MultiPolygon).

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.IGeoJSONObject
member.summary: Base Interface for GeoJSONObject types.

member.name: P:GeoJSON.Net.IGeoJSONObject.Type
member.summary: Gets the (mandatory) type of the GeoJSON Object.

member.name: P:GeoJSON.Net.IGeoJSONObject.CRS
member.summary: Gets the (optional) Coordinate Reference System Object.

member.name: P:GeoJSON.Net.IGeoJSONObject.BoundingBoxes
member.summary: Gets or sets the (optional) Bounding Boxes.
member.value: The value of the bbox member must be a 2*n array where n is the number of dimensions represented in the contained geometries, with the lowest values for all axes followed by the highest values. The axes order of a bbox follows the axes order of geometries. In addition, the coordinate reference system for the bbox is assumed to match the coordinate reference system of the GeoJSON object of which it is a member.

member.name: T:GeoJSON.Net.NullableDoubleTenDecimalPlaceComparer
member.summary: Compares nullable doubles for equality.
member.remarks: 10 decimal places equates to accuracy to 11.1 Î¼m.
